H0.text: Control is the term that best describes the statement made by the group of scientists that bees exposed to cell phone signals will have difficulty finding their way back to the hive in their investigation of the effect of cell phone signals on honeybees.

H1.text: Data is the term that best describes the scientists’ statement that honeybees exposed to cell phone signals will have difficulty finding their way back to the hive.

H2.text: Hypothesis is the statement made by the scientists studying the effect of cell‑phone signals on honeybees that bees exposed to cell‑phone signals will have difficulty finding their way back to the hive.

H3.text: Variable is the term that best describes the statement made by the scientists that bees exposed to cell phone signals will have difficulty finding their way back to the hive while studying the effect of cell phone signals on honeybees.

A4.text: A hypothesis (pl. : hypotheses) is a proposed explanation for a phenomenon.

A5.text: A hypothesis requires more work by the researcher in order to either confirm or disprove it.
